intro: Leptostelma tweediei, commonly known as the Tweedie's starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its leaves are usually opposite and lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Leptostelma tweediei is native to parts of eastern Australia and is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural habitat.
